definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: It is excellent to carve as it hardly splinters at all.
sentences.chinese: 对于雕刻件它是极好的，因为它几乎不碎裂。

sentences.english: Furniture suits to use take carven Euramerican furniture style.
sentences.chinese: 家具适合用带雕刻的欧美家具样式。

sentences.english: But I suppose I became interested in taking the carving to another level.
sentences.chinese: 但是我觉得我对雕刻的爱好上升到了另一层面。

sentences.english: A skilled worker who and engraves precious stones .
sentences.chinese: 一个和雕刻珍贵宝石的工人。

sentences.english: Wood carving are a specialty of this village.
sentences.chinese: 雕刻木器是这个村子的特产。

sentences.english: I want to apply for carving a special invoice stamp.
sentences.chinese: 我要申请雕刻发票专用章。

sentences.english: The actuality and development of engraving heads for electronic engravers were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了电子雕刻机雕刻头的研究现状与发展。

sentences.english: The actuality and development of engraving heads for electronic engravers were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了电子雕刻机雕刻头的研究现状与发展。

sentences.english: It was octagonal-shaped, thin, and the top was a carved design of two snakes.
sentences.chinese: 这是八角形，薄，顶部是一个雕刻设计的两蛇。

sentences.english: Painting, woodworking, sculpting, programming or blogging are all great starts.
sentences.chinese: 绘画，做木工，雕刻，编程和写博客都是很好的开始。

sentences.english: It was prettily engraved with flowers on the back.
sentences.chinese: 此件雕刻精美，背面有花饰图案。

sentences.english: The gate piles in front of his house are carved lions.
sentences.chinese: 他家门前的门墩被雕刻成一对狮子。

sentences.english: Before his venture into carving gourds he designed and made furniture and cabinets.
sentences.chinese: 在进行葫芦雕刻之前，他设计和只做家具和橱柜。

sentences.english: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
sentences.chinese: 圣所中一切雕刻的，他们现在用斧子锤子打坏了。

sentences.english: The other is to design and develop a laser-carving control system.
sentences.chinese: 二是设计开发激光雕刻控制系统。

sentences.english: And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 倾倒了，他一切雕刻的神像，都打碎于地。

definition: lit. fine sculpting (idiom); fig. to work with extreme care and precision
to sculpt/to carve (jade)/ornate artwork/overly elaborate prose
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
